text.text_translated:
Life of Pi is a book.
It tells an extraordinary story about Pi.
Pi is a teenage boy from India.
A big ship sinks at sea.
Pi rides in a small lifeboat on the Pacific Ocean.
A lifeboat is a small boat for emergencies.
A very dangerous tiger is with him.
He must live with the tiger on the boat.
It is the third book by Yann Martel.
He is a writer from Canada.
It came out in 2001.
After 2001, people bought over seven million copies around the world.
It also won several prizes.
People translated it into 41 languages.
Yann Martel's father worked for the government in other countries.
When Yann was a child, he moved a lot.
He lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7493 is below the required 0.75, showing loss of core nuance. For example, replacing “shipwrecked” with “big ship sinks at sea” weakens the sense of disaster and trapping. Suggestion: Restore key terms like “shipwrecked” and emphasize Pi’s entrapment to recover the original meaning.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Life of Pi is a book.
It tells an extraordinary story about Pi.
Pi is a teenage boy from India.
A big ship sinks at sea.
Pi rides in a small lifeboat on the Pacific Ocean.
A lifeboat is a small boat for emergencies.
A very dangerous tiger is with him.
He must live with the tiger on the boat.
It is the third book by Yann Martel.
He is a writer from Canada.
It came out in 2001.
After 2001, people bought over seven million copies around the world.
It also won several prizes.
People translated it into 41 languages.
Yann Martel's father worked for the government in other countries.
When Yann was a child, he moved a lot.
He lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France, and Mexico.
